alert.note: Alert for Union (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 8:17PM EDT until July 09 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northwestern Union County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 PM EDT, Stream gauge reports indicate runoff from earlier heavy rainfall is leading to rises on Goose Creek and other tributaries of the Rocky River. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Some roads in northwest Union County are likely to experience minor flooding. Howey Bottoms Road is known to flood, along with other roads between Indian Trail and Unionville. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indian Trail, Unionville, Hemby Bridge, Weddington, Stallings, Wesley Chapel, Lake Park, Fairview, Monroe, Matthews, and Mint Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
